Uses of Package
ussr.description.setup

Packages that use ussr.description.setup
ussr.description.setup Classes for defining the overall setup of the simulation. 
ussr.physics An abstract model of a physics engine, serves as the interface between physics-engine independent classes and the physics engine. 
ussr.physics.jme A physics simulation implementation based on JME (JMonkeyEngine). 
ussr.samples Generic infrastructure for simulations as well as examples of simulations mixing different robots. 
ussr.samples.atron Simulation examples based on the ATRON modular self-reconfigurable robot. 
ussr.samples.atron.natives ATRON examples based on native (implemented in C) controllers 
ussr.samples.atron.network ATRON network controller. 
ussr.samples.atron.simulations Concrete examples of ATRON simulations. 
ussr.samples.mtran Preliminary simulations based on the M-TRAN modular self-reconfigurable robot 
ussr.samples.odin Defintion of the Odin modular, reconfigurable robot. 
ussr.samples.odin.simulations Concrete Odin simulation examples. 
ussr.samples.stickybot Small example of a spherical robot with magnetic connectors on its surface. 
ussr.samples.white Simple and very preliminary example of a reconfigurable robot with hinge-joints at the edges. 
 

Classes in ussr.description.setup used by ussr.description.setup
BoxDescription
          A box-shaped obstacle that can be placed in the simulation
ModuleConnection
          A connection between two modules
ModulePosition
          Global starting position of a module and annotations for the module
WorldDescription.CameraPosition
          Default camera positions
WorldDescription.TextureDescription
          A physics-engine independent description of a texture that can be loaded from a file
 

Classes in ussr.description.setup used by ussr.physics
WorldDescription
          The description of a world in which a number of robot modules can be placed for the simulation.
 

Classes in ussr.description.setup used by ussr.physics.jme

          The description of a world in which a number of robot modules can be placed for the simulation.

          A physics-engine independent description of a texture that can be loaded from a file
